text: This is a story about three of my friends that I met in 1949 when I started college.
keypoint: I met my friends in 1949 at college

text: Actually I met them before that, we became friends after we all... went to school at the same place.
keypoint: We became friends after attending the same school

text: Previous to that during high school we'd all been high school athletes at different schools, and so we were acquainted. But then after graduation when we all enrolled in school, we found that the four of us were all now attending the same school, and we became quite good friends.
keypoint: We were high school athletes and became good friends in college

text: I was the kid from the farm, the other three guys all lived in the city.
keypoint: I was from the farm, they were city guys

text: So being big macho men that we all were, they used to like to come out to the farm and hunt, and they'd come out, and help me do chores and things like that. Then we'd go rabbit hunting and squirrel hunting and things of that nature.
keypoint: They enjoyed visiting the farm for hunting and chores

text: I never really enjoyed hunting. Uh ... being born and raised on the farm I was used to the outdoors, wasn't all that exciting to me. But these guys got a big kick out of it, so I'd go along just to be one of the group.
keypoint: I didn't enjoy hunting but joined to be part of the group

text: Things went on, we did this for several years, they were always coming out to the farm, and hunting.
keypoint: We continued this routine for several years

text: After we'd been acquainted for several years, one of them got the idea they'd like to go bear hunting up in Canada. Now that didn't really appeal to me, but I'd always been one of the group, and I couldn't find any real reason not to go, so I left them talk me into it, wasn't too hepped up on this at all.
keypoint: They wanted to go bear hunting in Canada, I was reluctant

text: I don't care anything really much about hunting period, let alone bear hunting. Be about my luck the bear would wind up hunting me. But as I said, I left them talk me into it.
keypoint: I disliked hunting, especially bear hunting, but agreed

text: So we took an airplane out of Fort Wayne, and we flew way up into Canada some place, and we landed on a lake, and then we rented canoes, and paddled for another ... day and a half it seemed to me, 'till we got way up in the north woods.
keypoint: We traveled by plane and canoe to the north woods

text: Then after we ... went as far as we could in the canoes, then we had to backpack for another ... five hundred miles I thought, 'till we got to this cabin that they had rented way up there in the north woods.
keypoint: We backpacked to a remote cabin in the woods

text: And after I got there, I was even more apprehensive than I had been even before we started, 'cause I didn't really need any part of that. That was pretty spooky looking territory, let me tell you.
keypoint: I felt apprehensive in the spooky territory

text: So we got up there, and got set up in the cabin, and ... got our groceries stored and everything. And after we got to discussing it those guys weren't any more hot about going out in those woods and looking for a bear than I was.
keypoint: We set up in the cabin but were hesitant to hunt

text: We sat around there for three or four days, played cards, and ate, and slept, and we just couldn't ... no one was in the mood to go out and hunt bear 'cause that's just a plain old spooky looking place.
keypoint: We spent days in the cabin avoiding bear hunting

text: We never ventured outside at night, we stayed right there in the old cabin.
keypoint: We stayed inside the cabin at night

text: Well after we'd been there for three or four days, we got to talking it over, and somebody said “Hey, if we don't go out and hunt some bear ... we've got to find a bear to take back home with us, or we're really going to get a bad time from the rest of the people, 'cause too many people know we'd gone bear hunting, and if we come home skunked with no bear they're really going to give us a bad time.”
keypoint: We realized we needed a bear to avoid ridicule

text: Soo ... no one wanted to go out, so we all decided that we'd cut the cards. Whoever got the high card ... would go out and get a bear, and the rest of them would skin him butcher him and pack him back down, so we could take him home with us.
keypoint: We decided to draw cards to choose a hunter

text: So you know who YOU KNOW WHO got the high card, the guy that didn't even want to be there in the first place. But I had agreed to play the game ...
keypoint: I drew the high card despite not wanting to hunt

text: So ... I took the old gun, and I go out bear hunting. I didn't like this at all. I'm walking out there in the woods for hours it seems like, and I just wasn't seeing any bears or anything, and finally I heard a noise, and I turned around, and there was the biggest old bear I'd ever seen in my life, I'd never even seen a PICTURE of one THAT big.
keypoint: I went hunting and encountered a huge bear

text: I whipped up the gun, and pulled the trigger, and nothing happened. I'd forgot to LOAD that turkey.
keypoint: I forgot to load the gun when facing the bear

text: Well he had ... he just had no desires to have me in his territory, and he made for me. Well there was nothing for me to do but run, and I turned around, I ran as hard as I could go, and I thought I used to be pretty fast, but that old bear, man he was gaining, he was just right on my heels ...
keypoint: The bear chased me as I ran for my life

text: And when I got within sight of that cabin I started yelling “OPEN THE DOOR, OPEN THE DOOR!” Man I was whipping down there just as hard as I could go, and that old bear right on my tail, and they opened the door, and I got right to the cabin door, I made a quick turn to the left, and that old bear went right on in.
keypoint: I reached the cabin and tricked the bear inside

text: I just reached back, and pulled the door shut, and said “THERE HE IS FELLOWS, YOU SKIN HIM, I'LL GO GET ANOTHER ONE!”
keypoint: I shut the door, leaving the bear for my friends

text: Now all this happened thirty years ago, and all my buddies agreed ... that I lived up to my commitment. But can you BELIEVE, they haven't asked me to go hunting one time since that day.
keypoint: I fulfilled my commitment, but never hunted again
